distance package¶

Submodules¶

distance.aaindex module¶

class distance.aaindex.Aaindex¶

Bases: object

Parse the AAindex1 datbase into a dictionary with id as key and the index as value.

The AAindex1 consits of indices, which translate a given amino acid into a real value. This value should represent a special property of this amino acid, for example hydrophobisity.

aaindex_dic¶

dict – A dictionary which maps the ID of an AAindex to the corresponding index, represented as a dictionary.

Notes

A index with NA values is discarded, beacause they can’t be used for distance computation.

distance.aaindex.immu_indices = ['GEIM800103', 'OOBM770104', 'PALJ810115', 'QIAN880132', 'OOBM850102', 'NADH010106', 'RADA880106', 'QIAN880112', 'WEBA780101', 'QIAN880125', 'JOND750101', 'QIAN880124', 'MUNV940101', 'HUTJ700102', 'MITS020101', 'KARP850103', 'FAUJ880113', 'ISOY800106', 'RACS820113', 'GEOR030105', 'QIAN880114', 'DIGM050101', 'MIYS850101']¶

list – List of Aaindex ID’s that are associated with immunogenicity

The creators of the immunogenicity predictor POPI used a advanced generic algorithmen to find aimno acid indices in the AAindex databese, that are associated with immunogenicity. These are listed here.

distance.aaindex.max_normalize(index)¶

Normalize a index of real numbers to a normalized index between [0,1].

distance.aaindex.positivize(index)¶

Turns an a index of real numbers to a index of positve real numbers.

distance.aaindex.z_normalize(index)¶

Normalize a index by with the z-score normalization method.

distance.distance module¶

This module contains a locally sensitiv hashing class for fast nearest neighbour computation. Additionaly it contains functions to represent a peptide/sequence as a feature vector based on AAindex or other metrics.

class distance.distance.HashTable(inp_dimensions: int, k_dot_products: int, bin_width: float)¶

Bases: object

Hash Table Implementation for random projection binning

N given input vectors are projected by k independent gausian normal distributed projection vectors and than placed in quantization bin’s of widht w.

Parameters:
  • k_dot_products (int) – k independet hash functions are used for binning.
  • bin_widht (float) – Width of a quantization bin.
  • inp_dimension (int) – Dimension of hashable input vectors.
k_dot_products¶

int – Hashfunction uses a projection of k dot products.

bin_widht¶

float – Width of a quantization bin.

b¶

array(float) – Uniformly distributed random variabales in [0,bin_width]

inp_dimension¶

int – Dimension of hashable input vectors.

hash_table¶

dict – Dictionary which is used as hash table.

projections¶

ndarray – Normal distributed N(0,1) projection matrix.

generate_hash(inp_vec)¶
keys()¶
values()¶
class distance.distance.LSH(inp_dimensions: int, num_projections: int = 10, k_dot_products: int = 3, bin_width: float = None)¶

Bases: object

Locally sensitv hashing

num_projections¶

int – Number of projection done for each binning

k_dot_products¶

int – Hashfunction uses a projection of k dot products.

bin_widht¶

float – Width of a quantization bin.

inp_dimension¶

int – Dimension of hashable input vectors.

hash_tables¶

list – List of Hashtable, which represents the num_projections times created hash tables

add(inp_vecs, labels)¶
compute_num_projections(bin_width, k_dot_products, fail_prob=0.1)¶

L needed to have a probability smaller than fail_prob that nearest neighbor is not in the same bucket.

mean_bucket_size()¶
mean_buckets()¶
nearest_neighbour(inp_vec)¶

Find the nearest_neighbour by hashing the inp_vec and find the nearest neighbour in the corresponding bin.

p1(bin_width)¶

Probability that two points with ||p-q|| < bin_width Fall into the same bucket

p2(bin_width, scale=2)¶

Probability that two points ||p-q|| > scale * bin_width Fall into the same bucket.

train_LSH(data, query_sample, tolerance=1.5, maxk=10, fail_prob=0.1)¶
class distance.distance.descriptor(seqs: list, indices: list = [], norm_method=<function descriptor.<lambda>>)¶

Bases: object

Amino acid descriptor designed to describe peptides with the AAIndex.

Parameters:
  • seqs – List of sequences that should be described
  • indices – List of indices, for example AAIndex indices, that should describe the sequences.
  • norm_method – A function that should normalize the values. Default value is no normalization.
sequences¶

list – List of sequences contained.

descriptors¶

list – List of arrays that describe the sequences.

add_index(index)¶

Add another index that should also describe the sequence. The descriptors are automatically updated.

add_seqs(seqs)¶

Add sequences to the descriptor. They will be automatically described by…

calculate_all()¶
change_norm_method(norm_method)¶

” Change to another normalization method, the descriptors are automatically updated.

normalize_all()¶
translate(word: str, indices)¶

Translate a string to feature vectors :param word: A sequence as string :type word: str :param indices: A List of dictionary which represent a aaindex :type indices: list

Returns:numpy ndarray of feature vectors
